AbstractSettings.description: Abstract/Shared Settings for the Objects or Policies.

alias.description: (APIC Only) The Name Alias feature (or simply `Alias` where the setting appears in the GUI) changes the displayed name of objects in the APIC GUI. While the underlying object name cannot be changed, the administrator can override the displayed name by entering the desired name in the Alias field of the object properties menu. In the GUI, the alias name then appears along with the actual object name in parentheses, as name_alias (object_name).
alias.title: alias - nameAlias

description.description: Description to add to the Object.  The description can be up to 128 characters.
description.title: description - descr

global_alias.description: (APIC Only) The Global Alias feature simplifies querying a specific object in the API. When querying an object, you must specify a unique object identifier, which is typically the object's DN. As an alternative, this feature allows you to assign to an object a label that is unique within the fabric.
global_alias.title: global_alias - alias

name.description: A Name for the Object or Policy.
name.title: name

access_or_native_vlan.description: Default is `0`.  This is used to assign the native vlan if this is a trunk or access vlan if a single vlan is being assigned.
access_or_native_vlan.title: access_or_native_vlan

allowed_vlans.description:
A string containing the List of VLANs Allowed on the ports attached to the AAEP.  This will act much like `switch trunk allowed vlan list`, but will be used to assign/filter the EPG's to be assigned to the AAEP.
In example: `1-5`, `1,3,5`, `1-5,10-16`, or just `1`.
allowed_vlans.title: allowed_vlans

infra_vlan.description: Default is `false`.  Flag to Allow Infrastructure VLAN on Ports assigned to this Attachable Access Entity Profile.
infra_vlan.title: infra_vlan - infraProvAcc

instrumentation_immediacy.description:
The EPG to AAEP deployment immediacy.  Options are:
  * immediate - Specifies that EPG policies (including contracts and filters) are downloaded to the associated leaf switch software upon deployment.
  * on-demand: (default) - Specifies that a policy (for example, VLAN, VXLAN bindings, contracts, or filters) is pushed to the leaf node only when an endpoint is discovered, attached to the (EPG).
instrumentation_immediacy.title: instrumentation_immediacy - instrImedcy

error_disable_recovery_interval.description: Default is `300`.  Sets the error disable recovery interval, which specifies the time to recover from an error-disabled state. The interval range is from 30 seconds to 65535 seconds.
error_disable_recovery_interval.title: error_disable_recovery_interval - errDisRecovIntvl

Access:Policies:Global:ErrorDisabledReco.title: error_disabled_recovery_policy - edrErrDisRecoverPol

Access:Policies:Global:ErrorDisabledReco.description:
Indicates Events where an Error Disable Recovery type is enabled (true or false).  Attributes are:
  * bpdu_guard
  * frequent_endpoint_move
  * loop_indication_by_mcp

bpdu_guard.description: Default is `true`.  Flag to enable or disable recovery for a BPDU Guard event.
bpdu_guard.title: bpdu_guardbpdu_guard

frequent_endpoint_move.description: Default is `true`.  Flag to enable or disable recovery for a Frequent Endpoint Move event.
frequent_endpoint_move.title: frequent_endpoint_move

loop_indication_by_mcp.description: Default is `true`.  Flag to enable or disable recovery for a Loop Indication by MCP event.
loop_indication_by_mcp.title: loop_indication_by_mcp

Access:Policies:Global:ErrorDisabledReco.title: events

Access:Policies:Global:McpInstancePolicy.description:
MisCabling Protocol Instance Settings.
Required:
  * key
Optional:
  * admin_state
  * description
  * enable_mcp_pdu_per_vlan
  * loop_detect_multiplication_factor
  * loop_protect_action
  * transmission_frequency
=================================================
API Information:
 - Class: `mcpInstPol`
 - Distinguished Named `uni/infra/mcpInstP-default`
GUI Location:
 - Fabric > Access Policies > Policies > Global > MCP Instance Policy default

enable_mcp_pdu_per_vlan.description: Default is `true`.  When set to true it enables Enable MCP PDU per VLAN.  When set to false it disables Enable MCP PDU per VLAN.
enable_mcp_pdu_per_vlan.title: enable_mcp_pdu_per_vlan - ctrl:pdu-per-vlan

initial_delay.description: Default is `180`.  The delay time before the MCP starts taking action based on the value of the Loop Protection Action, which is a value configured by the user. From the system bootup until the Initial Delay Timer timeout, MCP will only create a syslog entry if a loop is detected. The range is from 0 to 1800 seconds.
initial_delay.title: initial_delay - initDelayTime

key.description:
Default is `1`.  The key for the ACI Fabric MCP Instance.  See `local.tf` for reference to the sensitive variables.
This references the variable `var.mcp_instance_key` by default.  See `access_sensitive` in `locals.tf` for reference.
key.title: key

loop_detect_multiplication_factor.description: Default is `3`.  The multiplication factor that MCP uses to determine when a loop is formed. It denotes the number of continuous packets a port has to receive before claiming a loop is formed. The range is from 1 to 255. For strict mode MCP, during the grace timer period, the default value of 3 is overruled. Even if 1 packet is received, the port is disabled.
loop_detect_multiplication_factor.title: loop_detect_multiplication_factor - loopDetectMult

loop_protect_action.description: Default is `true`.  Determines how MCP acts when a loop is detected. MCP error-disables the port or syslog only based on this value. For strict mode MCP, even if you uncheck the Port Disable check box, the port is disabled if a loop is detected.Determines how MCP acts when a loop is detected. MCP error-disables the port or syslog only based on this value. For strict mode MCP, even if you uncheck the Port Disable check box, the port is disabled if a loop is detected.
loop_protect_action.title: loop_protect_action - loopProtectAct

Access:Policies:Global:McpInstancePolicy.title: mcp_instance_policy_default - mcpInstPol

Access:Policies:Global:McpInstancePolicy.description: Sets the transmission frequency of the instance advertisements. The range is from 100 milliseconds to 300 seconds.
Access:Policies:Global:McpInstancePolicy.title: transmission_frequency

Access:Policies:Global:QosClass.description:
Fabric Wide QoS Settings.
Optional:
  * description
  * elephant_trap_age_period
  * elephant_trap_bandwidth_threshold
  * elephant_trap_byte_count
  * elephant_trap_state
  * fabric_flush_interval
  * fabric_flush_state
  * micro_burst_spine_queues
  * micro_burst_leaf_queues
  * preserve_cos
=================================================
API Information:
 - Class: `qosInstPol`
 - Distinguished Name: `uni/infra/qosinst-default`
GUI Location:
 - Fabric > Access Policies > Policies > Global > QOS Class

elephant_trap_age_period.description: Default is `0`.  Elephant Trap Age Timer.  Range is `0-1800`.
elephant_trap_age_period.title: elephant_trap_age_period - EtrapAgeTimer

elephant_trap_bandwidth_threshold.description: Default is `0`.  Elephant flow track activeness.  Range is `0-1800`.
elephant_trap_bandwidth_threshold.title: elephant_trap_bandwidth_threshold - EtrapBwThresh

elephant_trap_byte_count.description: Default is `0`.  Elephant Trap flow identifier.  Range is `0-1800`.
elephant_trap_byte_count.title: elephant_trap_byte_count - EtrapByteCt

elephant_trap_state.description: Default is `false`.  Elephant Trap state.  Set to true to enable.
elephant_trap_state.title: elephant_trap_state - EtrapSt

fabric_flush_interval.description: Default is `500`.  Fabric Flush Interval in milliseconds.  Range is 100-1000.
fabric_flush_interval.title: fabric_flush_interval - FabricFlushInterval

fabric_flush_state.description: Default is `false`.  Fabric Priority Flow Control flush State.
fabric_flush_state.title: fabric_flush_state - FabricFlushSt

micro_burst_spine_queues.description: Default is `0`.  Micro Burst Spine Queues percent.  Range is 0-100.  **Note: Requires version 5.X of the APIC.
micro_burst_spine_queues.title: micro_burst_spine_queues - uburstSpineQueues

micro_burst_leaf_queues.description: Default is `0`.  Micro Burst Leaf Queues percent.  Range is 0-100.  **Note: Requires version 5.X of the APIC.
micro_burst_leaf_queues.title: micro_burst_leaf_queues - uburstTorQueues

preserve_cos.description: Default is `false`.  CoS Preservation, to guarantee the QoS priority settings of the various traffic streams, in a single-pod topology. In multipod topologies, use a DSCP policy to enable preserving QoS priority mapping for the traffic streams as they transit the inter-pod network.  QoS Class-Priority flow control requires that CoS levels be globally enabled for the fabric and assigned to the profiles of applications that generate FCoE traffic.
preserve_cos.title: preserve_cos - ctrl:dot1p-preserve

Access:Policies:Global:QosClass.title: qos_class - qosInstPol

mcp_instance_policy_default.description: Default is `false`.  Flag to configure recommended settings for the MCP Instance Policy default.

qos_class.description: Default is `false`.  Flag to configure recommended settings for the QOS Class - dot1p preserve attribute.
qos_class.title: qos_class

vpc_domain.description: Default is `false`.  Flag to configure recommended settings for the VPC Domain default Policy.
vpc_domain.title: vpc_domain

auto_max_speed.description:
Auto-max-speed for object interface FC policy. Allowed values are:
  * 4G
  * 8G
  * 16G
  * 32G: (default)
auto_max_speed.title: auto_max_speed - automaxspeed

fill_pattern.description:
Fill Pattern for native FC ports. Allowed values are:
  * ARBFF
  * IDLE: (default)
fill_pattern.title: fill_pattern - fillPattern

port_mode.description:
In which mode Ports should be used. Allowed values are:
  * f: (default)
  * np
port_mode.title: port_mode - portMode

receive_buffer_credit.description: Default is `64`.  Receive buffer credits for native FC ports Range: 16-64.
receive_buffer_credit.title: receive_buffer_credit - rxBBCredit

speed.description:
Port speed for object Fibre-Channel Interface Policy.  Allowed values:
  * 4G
  * 8G
  * 16G
  * 32G
  * 64G
  * auto: (default)
  * unknown
speed.title: speed

trunk_mode.description:
Trunking on/off for native FC ports.  Allowed values:
  * auto
  * trunk-off: (default)
  * trunk-on
  * un-init
trunk_mode.title: trunk_mode - trunkMode

qinq.description:
To enable or disable an interface for Dot1q Tunnel or Q-in-Q encapsulation modes, select one of the following:
  * corePort - Configure this core-switch interface to be included in a Dot1q Tunnel.  You can configure multiple corePorts, for multiple customers, to be used in a Dot1q Tunnel.
  * disabled: (default) - Disable this interface to be used in a Dot1q Tunnel.
  * doubleQtagPort - Configure this interface to be used for Q-in-Q encapsulated traffic.
  * edgePort - Configure this edge-switch interface (for a single customer) to be included in a Dot1q Tunnel.
qinq.title: qinq

reflective_relay.description:
Enable or disable reflective relay for ports that consume the policy.  Options are:
  * disabled: (default)
  * enabled
reflective_relay.title: reflective_relay - vepa

vlan_scope.description:
The layer 2 interface VLAN scope. The scope can be:
  * global: (default) - Sets the VLAN encapsulation value to map only to a single EPG per leaf.
  * portlocal - Allows allocation of separate (Port, Vlan) translation entries in both ingress and egress directions. This configuration is not valid when the EPGs belong to a single bridge domain.
VLAN Scope is not supported if edgePort is selected in the QinQ field.
vlan_scope.title: vlan_scope - vlanScope

auto_negotiation.description:
Policy auto negotiation for object fabric if pol.  Allowed values:
  * off
  * on: (default)
  * on-enforce
auto_negotiation.title: auto_negotiation - autoNeg

forwarding_error_correction.description:
Forwarding Error Correction for Link Level Policy.  Allowed values:
  * inherit: (default)
  * cl91-rs-fec
  * cl74-fc-fec
  * ieee-rs-fec
  * cons16-rs-fec
  * kp-fec
  * disable-fec
forwarding_error_correction.title: forwarding_error_correction - fecMode

link_debounce_interval.description: Default is `100`.  Link debounce interval for object fabric if pol. Range of allowed values: 0-5000.
link_debounce_interval.title: link_debounce_interval - linkDebounce

speed.description:
Port speed for object fabric if pol.  Allowed values:
  * 100M
  * 1G
  * 10G
  * 25G
  * 40G
  * 50G
  * 100G
  * 200G
  * 400G
  * inherit: (default)
  * unknown
speed.title: speed

receive_state.description:
The reception of LLDP packets on an interface.  Options are:
  * disabled
  * enabled: (default)
receive_state.title: receive_state - adminRxSt

transmit_state.description:
The transmission of LLDP packets on an interface.  Options are:
  * disabled
  * enabled: (default)
transmit_state.title: transmit_state - adminTxSt

maximum_number_of_links.description: Default is `16`.  Maximum number of links. Allowed value range is `1-16`.
maximum_number_of_links.title: maximum_number_of_links - maxLinks

minimum_number_of_links.description: Default is `1`.  Minimum number of links in port channel. Allowed value range is `1-16`.
minimum_number_of_links.title: minimum_number_of_links - minLinks

mode.description:
Port-Channel policy mode. Options are:
  * active: (default) - LACP mode that places a port into an active negotiating state in which the port initiates negotiations with other ports by sending LACP packets.
  * mac-pin - Used for pinning VM traffic in a round-robin fashion to each uplink based on the MAC address of the VM. MAC Pinning is the recommended option for channeling when connecting to upstream switches that do not support multichassis EtherChannel (MEC).
  * mac-pin-nicload - Pins VM traffic in a round-robin fashion to each uplink based on the MAC address of the physical NIC.
  * off - All static port channels (that are not running LACP) remain in this mode. If you attempt to change the channel mode to active or passive before enabling LACP, the device displays an error message.
  * passive - LACP mode that places a port into a passive negotiating state in which the port responds to LACP packets that it receives but does not initiate LACP negotiation. Passive mode is useful when you do not know whether the remote system, or partner, supports LACP.
mode.title: mode

Access:Policies:Interface:PortChannel:Co.description:
LACP Control Parameters.  Parameters are: 
  * fast_select_hot_standby_ports
  * graceful_convergence
  * load_defer_member_ports
  * suspend_individual_port
  * symmetric_hashing

fast_select_hot_standby_ports.description: Default is `true`.  Configures fast select for hot standby ports. Enabling this feature will allow fast selection of a hot standby port when last active port in the port-channel is going down.
fast_select_hot_standby_ports.title: fast_select_hot_standby_ports - ctrl:fast-sel-hot-stdby

graceful_convergence.description: Default is `true`.  Configures port-channel LACP graceful convergence. Disable this only with LACP ports connected to a Non-Nexus peer. Disabling this with Nexus peer can lead to port suspension.
graceful_convergence.title: graceful_convergence - ctrl:graceful-conv

load_defer_member_ports.description: Default is `false`.  Configures the load-balancing algorithm for port channels that applies to the entire device or to only one module.
load_defer_member_ports.title: load_defer_member_ports - ctrl:load-defer

suspend_individual_port.description: Default is `true`.  LACP sets a port to the suspended state if it does not receive an LACP bridge protocol data unit (BPDU) from the peer ports in a port channel. This can cause some servers to fail to boot up as they require LACP to logically bring up the port.
suspend_individual_port.title: suspend_individual_port - ctrl:susp-individual

symmetric_hashing.description: Default is `false`.  Bidirectional traffic is forced to use the same physical interface and each physical interface in the port channel is effectively mapped to a set of flows.
symmetric_hashing.title: symmetric_hashing - ctrl:symmetric-hash

Access:Policies:Interface:PortChannel:Co.title: control - ctrl

maximum_endpoints.description: Default is `0`.  The maximum number of endpoints that can be learned on the interface. The current supported range for the maximum endpoints configured value is from 0 to 12000. If the maximum endpoints value is 0, the port security policy is disabled on that port.
maximum_endpoints.title: maximum_endpoints - maximum

port_security_timeout.description: Default is `60`.  The delay time before MAC learning is re-enabled. The current supported range for the timeout value is from 60 to 3600.
port_security_timeout.title: port_security_timeout - timeout

bpdu_filter.description:
The interface level control that enables the BPDU filter for extended chassis ports.  Options are:
  * disabled: (default)
  * enabled
bpdu_filter.title: bpdu_filter - ctrl:bpdu-filter

bpdu_guard.description:
The interface level control that enables the BPDU guard for extended chassis ports.  Options are:
  * disabled: (default)
  * enabled
bpdu_guard.title: bpdu_guard - ctrl:bpdu-guard

allocation_mode.description:
The allocation mode. The values can be:
  * dynamic: (default) - Managed internally by the APIC to allocate VLANs for endpoint groups (EPGs). A vCenter Domain can associate only to a dynamic pool.
  * static - One or more EPGs are associated with a domain, and that domain is associated with a static range of VLANs. You must configure statically deployed EPGs within that range of VLANs.
allocation_mode.title: allocation_mode - allocMode

encap_blocks.description:
Blocks of VLANs to Add to the Pool.

Required:

Optional:

  * description

encap_blocks.title: encap_blocks - VLAN Pool Encapsulation Blocks

allocation_mode.description:
The allocation mode. The values can be:
  * dynamic - Managed internally by the APIC to allocate VLANs for endpoint groups (EPGs). A vCenter Domain can associate only to a dynamic pool.
  * inherit: (default)
  * static - One or more EPGs are associated with a domain, and that domain is associated with a static range of VLANs. You must configure statically deployed EPGs within that range of VLANs.
allocation_mode.title: allocation_mode - allocMode

role.description:
Role of the VLAN range. The options are:
  * external: (default) - Used for allocating VLANs for each EPG assigned to the domain. The VLANs are used when packets are sent to or from leafs.
  * Internal - Used for private VLAN allocations in the internal vSwitch by the Cisco ACI Virtual Edge (AVE). The VLANs are not seen outside the ESX host or on the wire.
role.title: role

vlan_range.description: Single VLAN; i.e. 1.  range of VLANs; i.e. 1-5. Or List of VLANs; i.e. 1-5,10-15
vlan_range.title: vlan_range

Access:Switches:LeafSwitches.title: leaf

bfd_ipv4_policy.description: The BFD IPv4 policy name.  Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD) is used to provide sub-second failure detection times in the forwarding path between Cisco ACI fabric border leaf switches configured to support peering router connections.
bfd_ipv4_policy.title: bfd_ipv4_policy - infraRsBfdIpv4InstPol

bfd_ipv6_policy.description: The BFD IPv6 policy name.  Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD) is used to provide sub-second failure detection times in the forwarding path between Cisco ACI fabric border leaf switches configured to support peering router connections.
bfd_ipv6_policy.title: bfd_ipv6_policy - infraRsBfdIpv6InstPol

bfd_multihop_ipv4_policy.description: The BFD multihop IPv4 policy name.  Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD) multihop for IPv4 provides subsecond forwarding failure detection for a destination with more than one hop and up to 255 hops.
bfd_multihop_ipv4_policy.title: bfd_multihop_ipv4_policy - infraRsBfdMhIpv4InstPol

bfd_multihop_ipv6_policy.description: The BFD multihop IPv6 policy name.  Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD) multihop for IPv6 provides subsecond forwarding failure detection for a destination with more than one hop and up to 255 hops.
bfd_multihop_ipv6_policy.title: bfd_multihop_ipv6_policy - infraRsBfdMhIpv6InstPol

copp_leaf_policy.description: The leaf CoPP policy name.  Control Plane Policing (CoPP) protects the control plane, which ensures network stability, reachability, and packet delivery.
copp_leaf_policy.title: copp_leaf_policy - infraRsLeafCoppProfile

copp_pre_filter.description: The CoPP Pre-Filter name.  A CoPP prefilter profile is used on spine and leaf switches to filter access to authentication services based on specified sources and TCP ports to protect against DDoS attacks. When deployed on a switch, control plane traffic is denied by default. Only the traffic specified in the CoPP prefilter profile is permitted.
copp_pre_filter.title: copp_pre_filter - infraRsIaclLeafProfile

dot1x_node_authentication_policy.description: The 802.1x node authentication policy name.  An 802.1x node authorization policy is a client and server-based access control and authentication protocol that restricts unauthorized clients from connecting to a LAN through publicly accessible ports.
dot1x_node_authentication_policy.title: dot1x_node_authentication_policy - infraRsL2NodeAuthPol

fast_link_failover_policy.description: The fast link failover policy name.  A fast link failover policy provides better convergence of the network.  Fast link failover policies are not supported on the same port as port profiles or remote leaf switch connections.
fast_link_failover_policy.title: fast_link_failover_policy - infraRsTopoctrlFastLinkFailoverInstPol

fibre_channel_node_policy.description: The default Fibre Channel node policy name.  Fibre channel node policies specify FCoE-related settings, such as the load balance options and FIP keep alive intervals.
fibre_channel_node_policy.title: fibre_channel_node_policy - infraRsFcInstPol

fibre_channel_san_policy.description: The Fibre Channel SAN policy name.  Fibre Channel SAN policies specify FCoE-related settings: Error detect timeout values (EDTOV), resource allocation timeout values (RATOV), and the MAC address prefix (also called FC map) used by the leaf switch. Typically the default value 0E:FC:00 is used.
fibre_channel_san_policy.title: fibre_channel_san_policy - infraRsFcFabricPol

forward_scale_profile_policy.description:
The forwarding scale profile policy name.  The forwarding scale profile policy provides different scalability options. The scaling types are:      * Dual Stack - Provides scalability of up to 12,000 endpoints for IPv6 configurations and up to 24,000 endpoints for IPv4 configurations.
  * High LPM - Provides scalability similar to the dual-stack policy, except that the longest prefix match (LPM) scale is 128,000 and the policy scale is 8,000.
  * IPv4 Scale - Enables systems with no IPv6 configurations to increase scalability to 48,000 IPv4 endpoints.
  * High Dual Stack - Provides scalability of up to 64,000 MAC endpoints, 64,000 IPv4 endpoints, and 24,000 IPv6 endpoints.
For more information about this feature, see the Cisco APIC Forwarding Scale Profiles document.
forward_scale_profile_policy.title: forward_scale_profile_policy - infraRsTopoctrlFwdScaleProfPol

netflow_node_policy.description: The NetFlow node policy name.  The node-level policy deploys two different NetFlow timers that specify the rate at which flow records are sent to the external collector.
netflow_node_policy.title: netflow_node_policy - infraRsNetflowNodePol

poe_node_policy.description: The PoE node policy name.  PoE node policies control the overall power setting for the switch.
poe_node_policy.title: poe_node_policy - infraRsPoeInstPol

ptp_node_policy.description: The PTP node policy name.  The Precision Time Protocol (PTP) synchronizes distributed clocks in a system using Ethernet networks.
ptp_node_policy.title: ptp_node_policy - infraRsPtpInstPol

synce_node_policy.description: The SyncE Node policy name.  Synchronous Ethernet (SyncE) provides high-quality clock synchronization over Ethernet ports by using known common precision frequency references.
synce_node_policy.title: synce_node_policy - infraRsSynceInstPol

usb_configuration_policy.description: The USB configuration policy name.  The USB configuration policy can disable the USB port on a Cisco ACI-mode switch to prevent someone booting the switch from a USB image that contains malicious code.
usb_configuration_policy.title: usb_configuration_policy - infraRsLeafTopoctrlUsbConfigProfilePol

activate_certificate.description:
Default is `false`.  Flag to specify that this should become the Active Certificate for the APIC GUI Management.
Download the Certificate chain from the Certificate authority.  Add the intermediate/Root Certificated to the file
########################################################
# Example /home/user/sensitive/intermediate_root_ca.pem
########################################################
-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
 
[this is the intermediate cert]
 
-----END CERTIFICATE-----
-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
 
[this is the root cert]
 
-----END CERTIFICATE-----

Then set the Sensitive VAR in the environment

 * Linux
   export TF_VAR_apic_ca_certificate_chain_1="/home/user/sensitive/intermediate_root_ca.pem"

 * Windows
   env:$TF_VAR_apic_ca_certificate_chain_1="/home/user/sensitive/intermediate_root_ca.pem"

########################################################
# Example /home/user/sensitive/certificate.pem
########################################################

-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
[omitted]
-----END CERTIFICATE-----"
 * Linux
   export TF_VAR_apic_certificate_1="/home/user/sensitive/certificate.pem"

 * Windows
   env:$TF_VAR_apic_certificate_1="/home/user/sensitive/certificate.pem"

########################################################
# Example /home/user/sensitive/private_key.pem
########################################################

"-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----
[omitted as well :)]
-----END PRIVATE KEY-----"

 * Linux
   export TF_VAR_apic_private_key_1="/home/user/sensitive/private_key.pem"

 * Windows
   env:$TF_VAR_apic_private_key_1="/home/user/sensitive/private_key.pem"
activate_certificate.title: activate_certificate

modulus.description:
The length of the encryption keys. A longer key length increases the difficulty of breaking the key.  Options are:
  * 512
  * 1024
  * 1536
  * 2048: (defualt)
modulus.title: modulus

trustpoint.description: Name for the Certificate Authority TrustPoint.
trustpoint.title: trustpoint - pkiTP:name

var_identity.description:
Default is `1`.  Identifier for the Sensitive Variables to Assign, CA, Certificate, Private Key.  See `local.tf` for reference to the sensitive variables.
By Default there is only two variables of combination `var.apic_ca_certificate_chain_[1|2]`, `var.apic_certificate_[1|2]`, `var.apic_private_key_[1|2]`.  You can add additional values to the local.tf `admin_sensitive` section if more are needed.
var_identity.title: var_identity

Admin:AAA:Security:SecurityDefaultSettin.description:
Block a user from being able to log in after the user fails a configured number of login attempts. You can specify how many failed login attempts the user can have within a specific time period. If the user fails to log in too many times, then that user becomes unable to log in for a specified period of time.

Attributes are:
  * enable_lockout
  * lockout_duration
  * max_failed_attempts
  * max_failed_attempts_window

enable_lockout.description:
Enable blocking of user logins after failed attempts. Allowed values are:
  * disable: (default)
  * enable
enable_lockout.title: enable_lockout - enableLoginBlock

lockout_duration.description: Default is `60`.  Duration in minutes for which login should be blocked.Duration in minutes for which future logins should be blocked Allowed range is `1-1440`.
lockout_duration.title: lockout_duration - blockDuration

max_failed_attempts.description: Default is `5`.  Maximum continuous failed logins before blocking user.max failed login attempts before blocking user login Allowed range is `1-15`.
max_failed_attempts.title: max_failed_attempts - maxFailedAttempts

max_failed_attempts_window.description: Default is `5`.  Time period for maximum continuous failed logins.times in minutes for max login failures to occur before blocking the user Allowed range is `1-720`.
max_failed_attempts_window.title: max_failed_attempts_window - maxFailedAttemptsWindow

Admin:AAA:Security:SecurityDefaultSettin.title: lockout_user - aaaBlockLoginProfile

smart_callhome.description:
Required:
  * contract_id
  * customer_contact_email
  * name
  *smart_destinations
  *smtp_server
Optional:
  * admin_state
  * contact_information
  * customer_contact_email
  * customer_id
  * description
  * from_email
  * phone_contact
  * reply_to_email
  * site_id
  * street_address
Smart Callhome provides an email-based notification for critical system policies in a similar way as Callhome. However, Smart Callhome collects a more specific selection of faults to deliver in email messages.
Note: Smart Callhome only collects and delivers faults.
The fault triggers that are typical of the Smart Callhome feature correspond to the kind of events that threaten to disrupt your network. Examples are:
  * Temperature Faults: The temperature of a sensor exceeds a threshold.
  * Fan/ Power Supply Faults: A fan or power supply unit goes offline.
  * Disk Utilization Faults: The disk usage of a device exceeds a threshold.
Smart Callhome collects faults and emails them to a network support engineer, a Network Operations Center, or to the Cisco Technical Assistance Center (TAC).
=================================================
API Information:
 - Class: `callhomeSmartGroup`
 - Distinguished Name: `uni/fabric/smartgroup-{name}`
GUI Location:
 - Admin > External Data Collectors > Monitoring Destinations > Smart Callhome > [Smart CallHome Dest Group]
=================================================
API Information:
 - Class: `callhomeProf`
 - Distinguished Name: `uni/fabric/smartgroup-{name}/prof`
GUI Location:

During operation, a fault or event in the Cisco Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI) system can trigger the sending of a system log (syslog) message to the console, to a local file, and to a logging server on another system. A system log message typically contains a subset of information about the fault or event. A system log message can also contain audit log and session log entries.
=================================================

 - Distinguished Name: `uni/fabric/slgroup-{name}`
GUI Location:
 - Admin > External Data Collectors > Monitoring Destinations > Syslog > {name}

notification_condition.description:
Default is `notifyOnlyOnFailures`.  Specifies under what pause condition will admin be notified via email/text as configured. This notification mechanism is independent of events/faults.
Options are:
  * notifyAlwaysBetweenSets - Always notify admin after a maintenance set.
  * notifyNever - Never notify admin after a maintenance set.
  * notifyOnlyOnFailures - Notify admin after a maintenance set, only if there were failures in the set.
notification_condition.title: notification_condition - maintMaintP:notifCond

scheduler_run_mode.description:
Default is `pauseOnlyOnFailures`.  Specifies whether to proceed automatically to next set of nodes once a set of nodes have gone through maintenance successfully.
Options are:
  * pauseAlwaysBetweenSets - Pause the scheduler after running a maintenance set irrespective of upgrade status of nodes in the set.
  * pauseNever - Do not pause the scheduler after a maintenance set, irrespective of upgrade status of nodes in the set.
  * pauseOnlyOnFailures - Pause the scheduler upon a failure of maintenance operation.
scheduler_run_mode.title: scheduler_run_mode - maintMaintP:runMode

silent_role_package_upgrade.description: Default is `false`.  Upgrading an internal package for hardware SDK, drivers, and so on, without upgrading the entire ACI switch firmware.
silent_role_package_upgrade.title: silent_role_package_upgrade - firmwareFwP:srUpgrade

smu_operation_flags.description:
Default is `smuReloadImmediate`.  SMU Operational Flags.  Options are:
  * patchHotSmu - SMU operation flags to indicate hot SMU. Node does not need a reload on hot SMU Install/Uninstall. Operator does not need to perform reload to make hot SMU to take affect.
  * smuReloadImmediate - SMU operation flags to indicate if node should be reloaded immediately on SMU Install/Uninstall.
  * smuReloadSkip - SMU operation flags to indicate if node should skip auto reload on SMU Install/Uninstall. Operator would perform the usual reload (or mode reload) later to make SMU to take affect.
smu_operation_flags.title: smu_operation_flags - maintMaintP:smuOperationFlags

smu_operation_type.description: Default is `smuInstall`.  Software Maintenance Operation Type options are:Deactivating and uninstalling a patch image (SMU image) that was already installed.
smu_operation_type.title: smu_operation_type - maintMaintP:smuOperation

target_simulator.description: Default is `false`.  Flag to Set when the target is an APIC Simulator.
target_simulator.title: target_simulator

target_version.description: The Version of software to apply to the policy.
target_version.title: target_version - maintMaintP:version

version_check_override.description:
Default is `untriggered`.  The version check override. This is a directive to ignore the version check for the next install. The version check, which occurs during a maintenance window, checks to see if the desired version matches the running version. If the versions do not match, the install is performed. If the versions do match, the install is not performed. The version check override is a one-time override that performs the install whether or not the versions match. Allowed values:
  * trigger
  * triggered
  * trigger-immediate
  * untriggered
version_check_override.title: version_check_override - maintMaintP:versionCheckOverride

Recurring or One Time Scheduler Windows.

delay_between_node_upgrades.description:
Default is `0`.  Delay between node upgrades. Delay between node upgrades in seconds. Range: `0-18000`.
NOTE: Only Applicable to One Time Windows.
delay_between_node_upgrades.title: delay_between_node_upgrades - nodeUpgInterval

maximum_concurrent_nodes.description: Default is `0`, aka `unlimited.  The concurrency capacity limit. This is the maximum number of tasks that can be processed concurrently.
maximum_concurrent_nodes.title: maximum_concurrent_nodes - concurCap

maximum_running_time.description: Default is `0`, aka `unlimited.  The processing time capacity limit. This is the maximum duration of the window. The range is 0 to (2^64 to 1) milliseconds. The default value of 0 indicates unlimited, meaning there is no time limit enforced on the scheduler window.
maximum_running_time.title: maximum_running_time - timeCap

processing_break.description:
A period of time taken between processing of items within the concurrency cap. Allowed Min Value: `00:00:00:00.001`(Format is DD:HH:MM:SS.Milliseconds).
* NOTE: (If user sets `00:00:00:00.000` as a value, provider will accept it but it'll set it as `none`).
processing_break.title: processing_break - procBreak

processing_size_capacity.description: Processing size capacity limitation specification. Indicates the limit of items to be processed within this window. Range: 1-65535.  The default is 0.
processing_size_capacity.title: processing_size_capacity - procCap

window_type.description:
The Type of Scheduler Window to Create.  Options are:

days.description:

  * Thursday
  * Friday

offset.description:

enable_dom.description:
A check box that enables or disables digital optical monitoring (DOM) for the fabric node control.
  * true: (default) - Enables digital optical monitoring.
  * false - Disables digital optical monitoring.
enable_dom.title: enable_dom - control

feature_selections.description:
ACI switch hardware supports either NetFlow or Cisco Tetration Analytics or telemetry, but not all three. If the APIC pushes both Cisco Tetration Analytics and NetFlow configurations to a particular node, the chosen priority flag alerts the switch as to which feature should be given priority. The other feature's configuration is ignored.
  * analytics - Analytic priority downloads the Cisco Tetration Analytics sensor software for installation on the switches.
  * netflow - Netflow priority downloads and installs the Cisco Netflow configuration on the switches to analyze network traffic.
  * telemetry: (default) - Telemetry priority is used in conjunction with the Network Insight Resources APIC App. This policy enables Cisco Telemetry configuration on the switches to analyze network traffic.
feature_selections.title: feature_selections - featureSel

Fabric:Policies:Monitoring:FabricNodeCon.title: fabric_node_controls - fabricNodeControl

display_format.description:
The date/time display format selector. The display format can be UTC or local. The date/time display format can be either of the following:
  * local: (default) - Date/time is displayed in local time.
  * utc - Date/time is displayed in UTC.
display_format.title: display_format - datetimeFormat:displayFormat

master_mode.description:
Enables the designated NTP server to provide undisciplined local clock time to downstream clients with a configured stratum number. For example, a leaf switch that is acting as the NTP server can provide undisciplined local clock time to leaf switches acting as clients.  The options are:
  * enabled - The designated NTP server provides undisciplined local clock time.
  * disabled: (default) - The designated NTP server does not provide undisciplined local clock time.
Notes:
  * Master Mode is only applicable when the server clock is undisciplined.
  * The default master mode stratum number is 8.
master_mode.title: master_modemaster_mode - masterMode

maximum_polling_interval.description: The maximum NTP default polling value in seconds.  The maximum interval range is from 4 to 16. This default is 6.
maximum_polling_interval.title: maximum_polling_interval - datetimeNtpProv:maxPoll

minimum_polling_interval.description: The minimum NTP default polling value in seconds.  The minimum interval range is from 4 to 16. This default is 5.
minimum_polling_interval.title: minimum_polling_interval - datetimeNtpProv:minPoll

Required:
  * hostname
Optional:

  * key_id
  * preferred

ntp_servers.title: ntp_servers - datetimeNtpProv

offset_state.description:
The display of the offset can be enabled or disabled. This enables you to view the difference between the local time and the reference time. 
  * enabled: (default)
  * disabled
offset_state.title: offset_state - datetimeFormat:showOffset

server_state.description:
Enables switches to act as NTP servers to provide NTP time information to downstream clients. The options are:
  * enabled - Switch, while being acting as a client, serves the time as server to other clients.
  * disabled: (default) - Switch acts as a client to an NTP server
Notes: To support the server functionality, it is always recommended to have a peer setup for the server. This enables the server to provide a consistent time to the clients.
  * Do not configure the node in the same fabric as the peer of the server.
  * The NTP server sends time info with a stratum number, an increment to the system peer's stratum number, to switches that are synched to the upstream server.
  * The server sends time info with stratum 16 if the switch clock is not synched to the upstream server. Clients are not able to sync to this server.
server_state.title: server_state - serverState

stratum_value.description: Specifies the stratum level from which NTP clients get their time synchronized. The range is from 1 to 15.  The default master mode stratum number is 8.
stratum_value.title: stratum_value - StratumValue

authorization_key.description: Default is `1`.  A value between 1 to 64 that will point to the snmp_authorization_key_{1-5} variable  (By default only 1-5 are supported), which should be loaded into the environment as `TF_VAR_snmp_authorization_key_{1-5}`.  This is referenced in `locals.tf` in the local variable `fabric_sensitive`.  More authorization key variables can be added there if needed.
authorization_key.title: authorization_key - authKey

authorization_type.description:
The authentication type for the user profile. The authentication type is a message authentication code (MAC) that is used between two parties sharing a secret key to validate information transmitted between them. HMAC (Hash MAC) is based on cryptographic hash functions. It can be used in combination with any iterated cryptographic hash function. HMAC MD5 and HMAC SHA1 are two constructs of the HMAC using the MD5 hash function and the SHA1 hash function. HMAC also uses a secret key for calculation and verification of the message authentication values. Supported types are:
  * hmac-md5-96
  * hmac-sha1-96: (default)
  * hmac-sha2-224
  * hmac-sha2-256
  * hmac-sha2-384
  * hmac-sha2-512
authorization_type.title: authorization_type - authType

privacy_key.description: Default is `1`.  A value between 1 to 64 that will point to the snmp_privacy_key_{1-5} variable (By default only 1-5 are supported), which should be loaded into the environment as `TF_VAR_snmp_privacy_key_{1-5}`.  This is referenced in `locals.tf` in the local variable `fabric_sensitive`.  More authorization key variables can be added there if needed.
privacy_key.title: privacy_key - privKey

privacy_type.description:
The privacy (encryption) type for the user profile. The type can be Data Encryption Standard (DES) or Advanced Encryption Standard (AES). Data Encryption Standard is a method of data encryption that uses a private (secret) key. DES applies a 56-bit key to each 64-bit block of data. Advanced Encryption Standard that uses a key with a length of 128 bits to encrypt data blocks with a length of 128 bits. The privacy types are:
  * aes-128
  * des
  * none: (default)
privacy_type.title: privacy_type - privType

instrumentation_immediacy.description:
The Static Path Binding deployment immediacy.  At this top level it will apply to all interfaces unless over-written on an individual interface with the same argument of instrumentation_immediacy.
Options are:
  * immediate - Specifies that EPG policies (including contracts and filters) are downloaded to the associated leaf switch software upon deployment.
  * on-demand: (default) - Specifies that a policy (for example, VLAN, VXLAN bindings, contracts, or filters) is pushed to the leaf node only when an endpoint is discovered, attached to the (EPG).

type.description:
COOP protocol is enhanced to support two ZMQ authentication modes:
  * compatible - Type COOP accepts both MD5 authenticated and non-authenticated ZMQ connections for message transportation.
  * strict: (default) - COOP allows MD5 authenticated ZMQ connections only.
Note: The APIC provides a managed object (fabric:SecurityToken), that includes an attribute to be used for the MD5 password. An attribute in this managed object, called `token`, is a string that changes every hour. COOP obtains the notification from the DME to update the password for ZMQ authentication. The attribute token value is not displayed.

SystemSettings:FabricWideSettings.description:
Attribute are:
  * disable_remote_ep_learning
  * enforce_domain_validation
  * enforce_epg_vlan_validation
  * enforce_subnet_check
  * leaf_opflex_client_authentication
  * leaf_ssl_opflex
  * reallocate_gipo
  * restrict_infra_vlan_traffic
  * ssl_opflex_versions
  * spine_opflex_client_authentication
  * spine_ssl_opflex
=================================================
API Information:
 - Class: `infraSetPol`
 - Distinguished Name: `uni/infra/settings`
GUI Location:
 - System > System Settings > Fabric Wide Settings

disable_remote_ep_learning.description:
Default is `true`.  You should enable this policy in fabrics which include the Cisco Nexus 9000 series switches, 93128TX, 9396PX, or 9396TX switches with the N9K-M12PQ uplink module, after all the nodes have been successfully upgraded to APIC Release 2.2(2x).
  * Note: After any of the following configuration changes, you may need to manually flush previously learned IP endpoints:
  * Remote IP endpoint learning is disabled.
  * The VRF is configured for ingress policy enforcement.
  * At least one Layer 3 interface exists in the VRF.
  * To manually flush previously learned IP endpoints, enter the following command on both VPC peers: vsh -c `clear system internal epm endpoint vrf <vrf-name> remote`
disable_remote_ep_learning.title: disable_remote_ep_learning - unicastXrEpLearnDisable

enforce_domain_validation.description: Default is `true`.  Enable a validation check when static paths are added, to ensure that a domain is attached to the EPG on the path.
enforce_domain_validation.title: enforce_domain_validation - domainValidation

enforce_epg_vlan_validation.description:
Default is `false`.  When checked, the system globally prevents overlapping VLAN pools from being assigned to EPGs.
  * Note:  If overlapping VLAN pools already exist and this parameter is checked, the system returns an error. You must assign VLAN pools that are not overlapping to the EPGs before choosing this feature.
  * If this parameter is checked and an attempt is made to add an overlapping VLAN pool to an EPG, the system returns an error.
enforce_epg_vlan_validation.title: enforce_epg_vlan_validation - validateOverlappingVlans

enforce_subnet_check.description: Default is `false`.  When checked, IP address learning on outside of subnets configured in a VRF, for all VRFs are disabled.
enforce_subnet_check.title: enforce_subnet_check - enforceSubnetCheck

leaf_opflex_client_authentication.description: Default is `true`.  To enforce Opflex client certificate authentication on leaf switches for GOLF and Linux.
leaf_opflex_client_authentication.title: leaf_opflex_client_authentication - leafOpflexpAuthenticateClients

leaf_ssl_opflex.description: Default is `true`.  To enable SSL Opflex transport for leaf switches.
leaf_ssl_opflex.title: leaf_ssl_opflex - leafOpflexpUseSsl

reallocate_gipo.description: Default is `false`.  Enable reallocating group IP outer addresses (Gipos) on non-stretched BDs to make room for stretched BDs.
reallocate_gipo.title: reallocate_gipo - reallocateGipo

restrict_infra_vlan_traffic.description: Default is `false`.  This feature restricts Infra VLAN traffic to only network paths specified by Infra security entry policies. When this feature is enabled, each leaf switch limits Infra VLAN traffic between compute nodes to allow only iVXLAN traffic. The switch also limits traffic to fabric nodes to allow only OpFlex and iVXLAN/VXLAN traffic. APIC management traffic is allowed on front panel ports on the Infra VLAN.
restrict_infra_vlan_traffic.title: restrict_infra_vlan_traffic - restrictInfraVLANTraffic

spine_opflex_client_authentication.description: Default is `true`.  To enforce Opflex client certificate authentication on spine switches for GOLF and Linux.
spine_opflex_client_authentication.title: spine_opflex_client_authentication - opflexpAuthenticateClients

spine_ssl_opflex.description: Default is `true`.  To enable SSL Opflex transport for spine switches..
spine_ssl_opflex.title: spine_ssl_opflex - opflexpUseSsl

SystemSettings:FabricWideSettings.title: fabric_wide_settings - infraSetPol

SystemSettings:FabricWideSettings:SslOpf.description:

This is only applicable to APIC version 5.2 and greater.
SystemSettings:FabricWideSettings:SslOpf.title: ssl_opflex_versions - opflexpSslProtocols

  * lsp_generation_maximum_wait_interval
  * lsp_generation_second_wait_interval
  * sfp_computation_frequency_initial_wait_interval

isis_mtu.description: Default is `1492`.  The IS-IS Domain policy LSP MTU. The MTU is from 128 to 4352.
isis_mtu.title: isis_mtu - mtu

isis_metric_for_redistributed_routes.description: Default is `63`.  The IS-IS metric that is used for all imported routes into IS-IS. The values available are from 1 to 63.
isis_metric_for_redistributed_routes.title: isis_metric_for_redistributed_routes - redistribMetric

lsp_fast_flood_mode.description:
The IS-IS Fast-Flooding of LSPs improves Intermediate System-to-Intermediate System (IS-IS) convergence time when new link-state packets (LSPs) are generated in the network and shortest path first (SPF) is triggered by the new LSPs. The mode can be:
  * disabled
  * enabled: (default)
lsp_fast_flood_mode.title: lsp_fast_flood_mode - isisLvlComp:lspFastFlood

lsp_generation_initial_wait_interval.description: Default is `50`.  The LSP generation initial wait interval. This is used in the LSP generation interval for the LSP MTU.  Permitted Values are 50 to 120000.
lsp_generation_initial_wait_interval.title: lsp_generation_initial_wait_interval - isisLvlComp:lspGenInitIntvl

lsp_generation_maximum_wait_interval.description: Default is `8000`.  The LSP generation maximum wait interval. This is used in the LSP generation interval for the LSP MTU.  Permitted Values are 50 to 120000.
lsp_generation_maximum_wait_interval.title: lsp_generation_maximum_wait_interval - isisLvlComp:lspGenMaxIntvl

lsp_generation_second_wait_interval.description: Default is `50`.  The LSP generation second wait interval. This is used in the LSP generation interval for the LSP MTU.  Permitted Values are 50 to 120000.
lsp_generation_second_wait_interval.title: lsp_generation_second_wait_interval - isisLvlComp:lspGenSecIntvl

sfp_computation_frequency_initial_wait_i.description: Default is `50`.  The SPF computation frequency initial wait interval. This is used in the SPF computations for the LSP MTU.  Permitted Values are 50 to 120000.
sfp_computation_frequency_initial_wait_i.title: sfp_computation_frequency_initial_wait_interval - isisLvlComp:spfCompInitIntvl

sfp_computation_frequency_maximum_wait_i.description: Default is `8000`.  The SPF computation frequency maximum wait interval. This is used in the SPF computations for the LSP MTU.  Permitted Values are 50 to 120000.
sfp_computation_frequency_maximum_wait_i.title: sfp_computation_frequency_maximum_wait_interval - isisLvlComp:spfCompMaxIntvl

sfp_computation_frequency_second_wait_in.description: Default is `50`.  The SPF computation frequency second wait interval. This is used in the SPF computations for the LSP MTU.  Permitted Values are 50 to 120000.
sfp_computation_frequency_second_wait_in.title: sfp_computation_frequency_second_wait_interval - isisLvlComp:spfCompSecIntvl

SystemSettings:ISISPolicy.title: isis_policy - isisDomPol

Optional Attribute are:
  * delay_restore_timer
  * include_apic_ports
  * number_of_active_ports
  * port_tracking_state
=================================================
API Information:
 - Class: `infraPortTrackPol`
 - Distinguished Name: `uni/infra/trackEqptFabP-default`
GUI Location:
 - System > System Settings > Port Tracking

delay_restore_timer.description: Default is `120`.  The timer that controls the delay restore interval time in seconds. The range is from 1 second to 300 seconds.
delay_restore_timer.title: delay_restore_timer - delay

include_apic_ports.description: Default is `false`.  If you put a check in the box, port tracking brings down the Cisco Application Policy Infrastructure Controller (APIC) ports when the leaf switch loses connectivity to all fabric ports (that is, there are 0 fabric links). Enable this feature only if the Cisco APICs are dual- or multi-homed to the fabric. Bringing down the Cisco APIC ports helps in switching over to the secondary link in the case of a dual-homed Cisco APIC.
include_apic_ports.title: include_apic_ports - includeApicPorts

number_of_active_ports.description: Default is `0`.  Number of active spine links that triggers port tracking. The range is from 0 to 12.
number_of_active_ports.title: number_of_active_ports - minlinks

port_tracking_state.description:
The administrative port tracking state. The state can be:
  * off
  * on: (default)
port_tracking_state.title: port_tracking_state - adminSt

SystemSettings:PortTracking.title: port_tracking - infraPortTrackPol

SystemSettings:PtpAndLatencyMeasurement.description:
Optional Attribute are:
  * announce_interval
  * announce_timeout
  * delay_request_interval
  * global_domain
  * global_priority_1
  * global_priority_2
  * precision_time_protocol
  * ptp_profile
  * sync_interval
=================================================
API Information:
 - Class: `latencyPtpMode`
 - Distinguished Name: `uni/fabric/ptpmode`
GUI Location:
 - System > System Settings > PTP and Latency Measurement

announce_interval.description:
Default is `1`.  Specifies the logarithm of the mean interval in seconds with base 2 for a master port to send announce messages. The range depends on the chosen profile:
  * AES67-2015: 0 to 4. These values result in a range of 1 to 16 seconds.
  * Default: 0 to 4. These values result in a range of 1 to 16 seconds.
  * SMPTE-2059-2: -3 to 1. These values result in a range of 0.125 to 2 seconds.
The value is applied to all PTP-enabled fabric links.
announce_interval.title: announce_interval - fabAnnounceIntvl

announce_timeout.description:
Default is `120`.  Specifies the number of announce messages that the system waits before the PTP announce message is considered expired. The range and the default depend on the chosen PTP profile:
  * AES67-2015: 2 to 10.
  * Default: 2 to 10.
  * SMPTE-2059-2: 2 to 10.
The value is applied to all PTP-enabled fabric links.
announce_timeout.title: announce_timeout - fabAnnounceTimeout

delay_request_interval.description:
Default is `-2`.  Specifies the logarithm of the mean interval in seconds with base 2 for a slave port to send delay request messages. The range depends on the chosen PTP profile:
  * AES67-2015: -3 to 5. These values result in a range of 0.125 to 32 seconds.
  * Default: 0 to 5. These values result in a range of 0.5 to 2 seconds.
  * SMPTE-2059-2: 0 to 5. These values result in a range of 0.5 to 2 seconds.
The value is applied to all PTP-enabled fabric links.
delay_request_interval.title: delay_request_interval - fabDelayIntvl

global_domain.description: Default is `0`.  Specifies the PTP domain number. Although multiple PTP domains are not supported in Cisco ACI, you can still change the domain number used in Cisco ACI. The same value is used on all leaf and spine nodes.  The valid range of values is 0 to 128.
global_domain.title: global_domain - globalDomain

global_priority_1.description: Default is `255`.  Specifies a value that is used to decide the grandmaster clock. The same value is used on all leaf and spine nodes. The ftag0 root spine switch uses the configured value, minus 1.  The valid range of values is 1 to 255. The default is 255 so that the root spine of ftag0 tree can be the grandmaster in case there is no external node that can serve as the grandmaster.
global_priority_1.title: global_priority_1 - prio1

global_priority_2.description: Default is `255`.  Specifies a value that is used to decide the grandmaster clock. The same value is used on all leaf and spine nodes. The ftag0 root spine switch uses the configured value, minus 1.  The valid range of values is 1 to 255. The default is 255 so that the root spine of ftag0 tree can be the grandmaster in case there is no external node that can serve as the grandmaster.
global_priority_2.title: global_priority_2 - prio2

precision_time_protocol.description:
Specifies the protocol administrative state. The state can be:
  * disabled - PTP is disabled on all leaf and spine nodes.
  * enabled: (default) - PTP is enabled on all fabric links that belong to the ftag tree with ID 0 (ftag0 tree), which is one of the internal tree topologies that is automatically built based on Cisco ACI infra ISIS for loop free connectivity between all leaf and spine nodes in each pod.
precision_time_protocol.title: precision_time_protocol - state

ptp_profile.description:
Specifies the PTP profile, which defines the range and default value of various PTP parameters, such as intervals. The values are:
  * AES67-2015: (default) - AES67-2015, which is the standard for audio over Ethernet and audio over IP interoperability.
  * Default - IEEE 1588-2008, which is the default PTP profile for clock synchronization.
  * SMPTE-2059-2 - SMTPE ST2059-2015, which is the standard for video over IP.
The profile is applied to all PTP-enabled fabric links.
ptp_profile.title: ptp_profile - fabProfileTemplate

sync_interval.description:
Default is `-3`.  Specifies the logarithm of the mean interval in seconds with base 2 for a master port to send synchronization messages. The range and the default depend on the chosen PTP profile:
  * AES67-2015: -4 to 1. These values result in a range of 0.0625 to 16 seconds.
  * Default: -1 to 1. These values result in a range of 0.5 to 2 seconds.
  * SMPTE-2059-2: -4 to -1. These values result in a range of 0.0625 to 0.5 seconds. SMPTE defines this as -7 to -1. However, Cisco ACI allows only -4 to -1 for hardware and software stability.
The value is applied to all PTP-enabled fabric links.
sync_interval.title: sync_interval - fabSyncIntvl

SystemSettings:PtpAndLatencyMeasurement.title: ptp_and_latency_measurementity_preference - latencyPtpMode

label_match_criteria.description:

Contract subjects of a given producer or consumer of that contract determine that consumers and providers can communicate.  The match type algorithm is determined by the matchT attribute that can have one of the following values:

  * AF41 - low drop-Flash Override
  * AF42 - medium drop Flash Override

  * CS1 - class of service level 1
  * CS2 - class of service level 2

  * CS4 - class of service level 4
  * CS5 - class of service level 5
  * CS6 - class of service level 6

flood_in_encapsulation.description:
Specifies whether flooding is enabled for the routing protocols. If flooding is disabled, unicast routing is performed on the target IP address.  The options are:
  - disabled: (default)
  - enabled
flood_in_encapsulation.title: flood_in_encapsulation - floodOnEncap

intra_epg_isolation.description: Default is `unenforced`.  Intra-EPG endpoint isolation policies provide full isolation for virtual or physical endpoints; no communication is allowed between endpoints in an EPG that is operating with isolation enforced. Isolation enforced EPGs reduce the number of EPG encapsulations required when many clients access a common service but are not allowed to communicate with each other.  An EPG is isolation enforced for all Cisco Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI) network domains or none. While the Cisco ACI fabric implements isolation directly to connected endpoints, switches connected to the fabric are made aware of isolation rules according to a primary VLAN (PVLAN) tag.
intra_epg_isolation.title: intra_epg_isolation - pcEnfPref

preferred_group_member.description:
Default is `false`.  If an EPG or External EPG is marked as a Preferred Group Member, it is put into an internally created contract group where all members of the group can communicate with each other without requiring a contract between them.  The options are:
  * false: (default) - The External EPG is not included in the subgroup.
  * true - The External EPG is included in the subgroup.
preferred_group_member.title: preferred_group_member - prefGrMemb

useg_epg.description:
Default is `false`.  Indicates Whether this EPG is a micro-segmented EPG, defined by micro-segmentation attributes and identical network behavior.
Note: Micro-segmentation associates endpoints from multiple EPGs into a micro-segmented EPG according to virtual machine attributes, IP address, or MAC address. Virtual machine attributes include: VNIC domain name, VM identifier, VM name, hypervisor identifier, VMM domain, datacenter, operating system, or custom attribute.
useg_epg.title: useg_epg - isAttrBasedEPg

vlans.description: This is just used for the Inband Management EPG.

items.description: VLAN Identifier.
items.title: vlan_id

vlans.title: vlans

allow_micro_segmentation.description: Default is `false`.  (VMM Domains - optional) - Boolean flag for allow micro segment. `true` maps to class_pref=`useg` and `false` maps to class_pref=`encap`
allow_micro_segmentation.title: allow_micro_segmentation - classPref

custom_epg_name.description: (VMM Domains - optional) - User-configured port-group display name.
custom_epg_name.title: custom_epg_name - customEpgName

delimiter.description:
(VMM Domains - optional) - The delimiter symbol to use with the VMware portgroup name.
  * The acceptable symbols are |, ~, !, @, ^, +, =, and _.
  * The default symbol is `|`
delimiter.title: delimiter

deploy_immediacy.description:
(VMM Domains - optional) - Once policies are downloaded to the leaf software, deployment immediacy can specify when the policy is pushed into the hardware policy CAM. The options are:
  * immediate - Specifies that the policy is programmed in the hardware policy CAM when the policy is downloaded in the leaf software.
  * on-demand: (default) - Specifies that the policy is programmed in the hardware policy CAM only when the first packet is received through the data path. This process helps to optimize the hardware space.
deploy_immediacy.title: deploy_immediacy - instrImedcy

domain_type.description:
The Type of Domain you are assigning.  Options are:
  * physical: (default)
  * vmm
domain_type.title: domain_type

enhanced_lag_policy.description: (VMM Domains - optional) - Allows you to associate the EPG with a vCenter domain that has an enhanced link aggregation group (LAG) configured on it.  The policy consists of distributed virtual switch (DVS) uplink port groups configured in LAGs and associated with a load-balancing algorithm.  You need to configure the policy first for the VMM domain.
enhanced_lag_policy.title: enhanced_lag_policy - lagPolicyName

number_of_ports.description: Default is `0`.  (VMM Domains - optional) - REQUIRED If Port Binding is staticBinding.  Number of Ports to assign to the VMM Domain Policy.
number_of_ports.title: number_of_ports - numPorts

port_allocation.description:
(VMM Domains - optional) - The port allocation mode.  Only used when port_binding is staticBinding.  Options are:
  * elastic
  * fixed
  * none: (default)
port_allocation.title: port_allocation - portAllocation

port_binding.description:
(VMM Domains - optional) - Enables you to choose a port-binding method:
  * default - Default
  * dynamic_binding - Dynamic Binding
  * ephemeral - Ephemeral
  * static_binding - Static
port_binding.title: port_binding - bindingType

resolution_immediacy.description:
(VMM Domains - optional) - Specifies whether policies are resolved immediately or when needed. The options are:
  * immediate - Specifies that EPG policies (including contracts and filters) are downloaded to the associated leaf switch software upon hypervisor attachment to the VMware vSphere Distributed Switch (VDS). LLDP or OpFlex permissions are used to resolve the hypervisor to leaf node attachments.
  * on-demand - Specifies that a policy (for example, VLAN, VXLAN bindings, contracts, or filters) is pushed to the leaf node only when a hypervisor is attached to VDS and a VM is placed in the port group (EPG).
  * pre-provision: (default) - Specifies that a policy (for example, VLAN, VXLAN binding, contracts, or filters) is downloaded to a leaf switch even before a hypervisor is attached to the VDS, thereby pre-provisioning the configuration on the switch.
  * Notes:  The default for Cisco AVS and Cisco ACI Virtual Edge is immediate.  The default for VMware VDS is pre-provision unless the Allow Microsegmentation check box is checked. In that case, resolution is immediate, and the options are grayed out.
resolution_immediacy.title: resolution_immediacy - resImedcy

switch_provider.description:
(VMM Domains - optional) - The provider type of the VMM Domain.  Options are:
  * CloudFoundry
  * Kubernetes
  * Microsoft
  * OpenShift
  * OpenStack
  * Redhat
  * VMware: (default)
switch_provider.title: switch_provider

vlan_mode.description:
(VMM Domains - optional) - Setting to determine the Mode of the VLAN Assignment.  Options are:
  * dynamic: (default) - The VLAN is dynamically assigned from the VLAN Pool.
  * static - The VLAN is statically assigned from the VLAN Pool.
vlan_mode.title: vlan_mode

vlans.description: (VMM Domains - optional) - Only required when the vlan_mode is set to static.  List of VLANs to assign to the VMM Domain.  The list should contain One VLAN for typical deployments, encapsulation VLAN.  If doing micro-segmentation/private-vlan then the list should contain two vlans with the first VLAN for encapsulation and the second VLAN for primary encapsulation.

items.description: VLAN Identifier.
items.title: vlan_id

vlans.title: vlans

Tenants:ApplicationProfiles:ApplicationE.description:
(VMM Domains - optional) - 
  * allow_promiscuous: (VMM Domains - optional) - Allows all packets to pass to the VMM domain, which is often used to monitor network activity.
  * accept - All traffic is received within the VMM domain.
  * reject: (default) - Packets that do not include the network address are dropped.
  * forged_transmits: (VMM Domains - optional) - Specifies whether to allow forged transmits. A forged transmit occurs when a network adapter starts sending out traffic that identifies itself as something else. This security policy compares the effective address of the virtual network adapter and the source address inside of an 802.3 Ethernet frame generated by the virtual machine to ensure that they match.
  * accept - Non-matching frames are received.
  * reject: (default) - All non-matching frames are dropped.
  * mac_changes: (VMM Domains - optional) - Allows definition of new MAC addresses for the network adapter within the virtual machine (VM).
  * accept - Allows new MAC addresses.
  * reject: (default) - Does not allow new MAC addresses.
Tenants:ApplicationProfiles:ApplicationE.title:
security - vmmSecP
GUI Location: Application EPGs > Domains > VMM Security.

destination_port_from.description:
The start of the destination port range. The start of the port range is determined by the server type. You can define a single port by specifying the same value in the From and To fields, or you can define a range of ports from 0 to 65535 by specifying different values in the From and To fields. Instead of specifying a number, you can instead choose one of the following server types to use the pre-defined port of that type:
  * 1-65535
  * dns
  * ftpData
  * http
  * https
  * pop3
  * rtsp
  * smtp
  * unspecified: (default)
destination_port_from.title: destination_port_from - dFromPort

destination_port_to.description:
The end of the destination port range. The end of the port range is determined by the server type. You can define a single port by specifying the same value in the From and To fields, or you can define a range of ports from 0 to 65535 by specifying different values in the From and To fields. Instead of specifying a number, you can instead choose one of the following server types to use the pre-defined port of that type:
  * 1-65535
  * dns
  * ftpData
  * http
  * https
  * pop3
  * rtsp
  * smtp
  * unspecified: (default)

  * tcp
  * udp
  * unspecified: (default)
ip_protocol.title: ip_protocol - prot

match_dscp.description:
Match only traffic marked with the specified Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) value. Enter the DSCP value to match.
  * Note: Contracts using filters matching DSCP values are only supported on cloud scale switches  “EX/FX/FX2/FXP/GX” etc. For example, N9K-93108TC-EX.
  * AF11 - low drop Priority
  * AF12 - medium drop Priority
  * AF13 - high drop Priority
  * AF21 - low drop Immediate
  * AF22 - medium drop Immediate
  * AF23 - high drop Immediate
  * AF31 - low drop Flash
  * AF32 - medium drop Flash
  * AF33 - high drop Flash
  * AF41 - low drop-Flash Override
  * AF42 - medium drop Flash Override
  * AF43 - high drop Flash Override
  * CS0 - class of service level 0
  * CS1 - class of service level 1
  * CS2 - class of service level 2
  * CS3 - class of service level 3
  * CS4 - class of service level 4
  * CS5 - class of service level 5
  * CS6 - class of service level 6
  * CS7 - class of service level 7
  * EF - Expedited Forwarding Critical
  * VA - Voice Admit
  * unspecified: (default)
match_dscp.title: match_dscp - matchDscp

match_only_fragments.description: Default is `false`.  Match only packet fragments. When enabled, the rule applies to any IP fragment with an offset that is greater than 0 (all IP fragments except the first). When disabled, the rule will not apply to IP fragments with an offset greater than 0 because TCP/UDP port information can only be checked in initial fragments.
match_only_fragments.title: match_only_fragments - applyToFrag

source_port_from.description:
The start of the source port range. The start of the port range is determined by the server type. You can define a single port by specifying the same value in the From and To fields, or you can define a range of ports from 0 to 65535 by specifying different values in the From and To fields. Instead of specifying a number, you can instead choose one of the following server types to use the pre-defined port of that type:
  * 1-65535
  * dns
  * ftpData
  * http
  * https
  * pop3
  * rtsp
  * smtp
  * unspecified: (default)
source_port_from.title: source_port_from - sFromPort

source_port_to.description:
The end of the source port range. The end of the port range is determined by the server type. You can define a single port by specifying the same value in the From and To fields, or you can define a range of ports from 0 to 65535 by specifying different values in the From and To fields. Instead of specifying a number, you can instead choose one of the following server types to use the pre-defined port of that type:
  * 1-65535
  * dns
  * ftpData
  * http
  * https
  * pop3
  * rtsp
  * smtp
  * unspecified: (default)
source_port_to.title: source_port_to - sToPort

stateful.description: Default is `false`.  Specifies if the entry is stateful. This applies to the TCP protocol only.
stateful.title: stateful - stateful

established.description: Default is `false`.  Establilshed - Combination of Ack and Reset

Tenants:Networking:BridgeDomains:Advance.description:
Map of Advanced/Troubleshooting Configuration Parameters for the Bridge Domain.
Optional Attributes:
  * disable_ip_data_plane_learning_for_pbr
  * endpoint_clear
  * first_hop_security_policy
  * intersite_bum_traffic_allow
  * intersite_l2_stretch
  * monitoring_policy
  * netflow_monitor_policies
  * optimize_wan_bandwidth
  * rogue_coop_exception_list

disable_ip_data_plane_learning_for_pbr.description:
Default is `false`.  Controls whether the remote leaf switch should update the IP-to-VTEP information with the source VTEP of traffic coming from this bridge domain. The options are:
  * false: (default)
  * true - Change this setting to true, only if the bridge domain is to be associated with policy-based redirect (PBR) enabled endpoint groups.
  * Note: Use caution when changing the default setting for this field. Setting this option to no can cause suboptimal traffic forwarding for non-PBR scenarios.
disable_ip_data_plane_learning_for_pbr.title: disable_ip_data_plane_learning_for_pbr - ipLearning

endpoint_clear.description: Default is `false`.  Set this to Clear the Endpoint Table on the Bridge Domain.
endpoint_clear.title: endpoint_clear - epClear

first_hop_security_policy.description: The name of a First Hop Security Policy to Associate.
first_hop_security_policy.title: first_hop_security_policy -

intersite_bum_traffic_allow.description: Default is `false`.  When extending the bridge domain between sites this option is to permit broadcast unknown multicast (BUM) traffic between the sites.
intersite_bum_traffic_allow.title: intersite_bum_traffic_allow - intersiteBumTrafficAllow

intersite_l2_stretch.description: Default is `false`.  Extend the Bridge Domain between ACI Fabrics.
intersite_l2_stretch.title: intersite_l2_stretch - intersiteL2Stretch

netflow_monitor_policies.description: A NetFlow Monitor Policy identifies packet flows for ingress IP packets and provides statistics based on these packet flows.
netflow_monitor_policies.title: netflow_monitor_policies - netflowMonitorPol

optimize_wan_bandwidth.description: Default is `false`.  Any defined bridge domain is associated with a multicast group address (or a set of multicast addresses), usually referred to as the GIPo address. Depending on the number of configured bridge domains, the same GIPo address may be associated with different bridge domains. Thus, when flooding for one of those bridge domains is enabled across sites, BUM traffic for the other bridge domains using the same GIPo address is also sent across the sites and will then be dropped on the received spine nodes. This behavior can increase the bandwidth utilization in the intersite network.  Because of this behavior, when a bridge domain is configured as stretched with BUM flooding enabled from the Cisco Multi-Site Orchestrator GUI, by default a GIPo address is assigned from a separate range of multicast addresses. This is reflected in the GUI by the "OPTIMIZE WAN BANDWIDTH".
optimize_wan_bandwidth.title: optimize_wan_bandwidth - OptimizeWanBandwidth

rogue_coop_exception_list.description: A list of MAC addresses for which you want to have a higher tolerance for endpoint movement with rogue endpoint control before the endpoints get marked as rogue. Endpoints in the rogue/COOP exception list get marked as rogue only if they move 3000 or more times within 10 minutes. After an endpoint is marked as rogue, the endpoint is kept static so that learning is prevented and the traffic to and from the endpoint is dropped. The rogue endpoint is deleted after 30 seconds.

items.description: MAC Address to add to the Bridge Domain Rogue Exception List.
items.title: mac

rogue_coop_exception_list.title: rogue_coop_exception_list - fvRogueExceptionMac

Tenants:Networking:BridgeDomains:Advance.title: advanced_troubleshooting

When utilizing Network Centric Mode, assigning this to the BD Directly will create the EPG with the same name as the Bridge Domain.
